paper_abstract: Given a separable strongly self-concordant function f : R(n) -> R, we show the associated spectral function F(X) = (f o lambda)(X) is also a strongly selfconcordant function. In addition, there is a universal constantO = 22 such that if f (x) is a separable self-concordant barrier, then O2F(X) is a self-concordant barrier. This generalizes the relationship between the standard logarithmic barriers -Sigma(n)(i=1) log xi and -log det X and gives a partial solution to a conjecture of L. Tun el.
paper_title: Separable self-concordant spectral functions and a conjecture of Tuncel
